resources.string: If you are reading this, something broke. Please contact the study administrators, and tell them that there is a bug in the survey!
This device does not meet minimum specifications for this app, to avoid any issues resulting from this please uninstall the app.

Thank you for completing the survey. Don\'t forget, no clinician will see your answers. So, if you need help or you\'re thinking about harming yourself, please call your clinician. You can also press the \"Call My Clinician\" button above to call your clinician.
There has been an error; your answers may not have been recorded and saved
Downloading the most up-to-date survey questions from the server...
User ID does not match the one in the system. Try again
Incorrect user ID and password combination
Password does not match confirm password
Your password must be longer than %d characters.
Call the research assistant to get a temporary password
Call the research assistant to get a temporary password. Your ID is \"%s\".

Press the button to call the research assistance and ask for a temporary password. Identify yourself only by your User ID instead of by name. Enter the temporary password you receive and a new, permanent password you want to use.
Enter your temporary password (get this by calling the research assistant)
Please enter your new permanent password (the one you want to use)
Enter your new permanent password again (the one you want to use)
Please fill out the information below
Please enter your temporary registration password:
Please enter your new, permanent password:
Enter your new, permanent password again:
The phone number of your primary care physician
The phone number for the research assistant

We would like to know how your day is going. When you are ready, please press \"Record\" and speak for about 2 minutes. Press \"Stop\" when you are finished. The recording will stop automatically after 4 minutes. Remember, researchers will not review and analyze your data until the end of the study, so if you are ill or in danger and need to speak with your clinician, press the \"Call My Clinician\" button.
"The voice recording can't be longer than "
" minutes, so your recording was automatically stopped and saved"

Beiwe is an application that runs on your cell phone and helps researchers collect information about your health and behaviors. It asks you to fill out short surveys, and to make a recording of your voice, once a day. Beiwe continuously collects information about your location (using your phone's GPS) and how much you move around (using your phone's accelerometer). It also monitors how much you use your phone for calling and texting, and it keeps track of the different people you communicate with. Importantly, Beiwe does not record the names or phone numbers of anyone you communicate with. While it can tell if you call the same person more than once, it does not know who that person is. Beiwe does not record the content of your text messages or phone calls. It also keeps track of the different Wi-Fi networks in your area, but the names of those networks are replaced with random codes. Finally, Beiwe can tell if you are near another phone that is also running this application.

Although Beiwe collects a large amount of data, all of this data is processed to protect your privacy. This means that the application does not know your name, your phone number, or anything else that could identify you. Beiwe only knows you by an identification number. Because Beiwe does not know who you are, it cannot communicate with your clinician if you are ill or in danger. Researchers will not review the data Beiwe collects until the end of the study. To make it easier for you to connect with your clinician, the "Call my Clinician" button appears at the top of every page. In order for the button to work, you must enter your clinician's phone number into Beiwe. You can change it as often as needed.

Beiwe was conceived and designed by Dr. Jukka-Pekka "JP" Onnela at the Harvard School of Public Health. The research study in which you are enrolled is run by Dr. Roy Perlis at Massachusetts General Hospital. The software was built by Zagaran, Inc., in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
"Phone numbers must be exactly %d digits long."
You must enter values for the two phone numbers above

You have indicated you do not consent to the terms of this application. If you press "I understand" the app will exit, and you will not be enrolled in the study. If you press "Cancel" the app will not exit and you will be able to press the "I Consent" button, which will then enroll you in the study.
